title: Guava Punch Beverage Company
subtitle: Logo and promotional Poster
description: Developed a fictional beverage company profile and designed a logo and a promotional poster that would attract their target audience.
intro: This project started by developing a logo using shapes and the pen tool on Adobe Illustrator, arranging the components in an orderly manner using layers. Text components were meant to be outlined, to make sure the logo was scalable. A black and white version was requested, to make sure the logo was colour-independent.

In order to create the promotional poster, we had to include a background image, and at least one 3D element that was placed on a realistic scene, blending in with the background image. Lighting and perspective were an important element of this project.As I had previously created a logo for a fictitious beverage company called Guava Punch, I decided to use that company as a foundation for this project, and develop the promotional poster that included a beverage container.

steps.name: Beverage Company Conception
steps.description: First, I selected a name for the company and I defined what kind of drink they sell. I provide as much context as possible for the brand, such as in what places / locations would this drink be found, which colours, shapes and typography would be representative of it, and why would those choices would be a good fit. Finally I defined who the target audience is, their interests, distinctive traits and general demographics they would have.

steps.name: Logo Brainstorming
steps.description: The process began by settling on a beverage. I got inspired by a drink I used to enjoy on my childhood which was guava nectar, and decided to add sparkling water as a twist, to make it more interesting. I haven't seen a beverage combining these two elements on Canada. I wanted to create a casual beverage that could be enjoyed by everyone, as a soft drink. I settled on a 12 fl oz can.

steps.name: Creative Process
steps.description: The colour palette was decided based on the beverage main ingredient: the guava fruit, which has a pink vibrant colour, as well as some green from its leaves. The logo gravitates towards round shapes, to reference the bubbles the sparkling water will add to the mix.

steps.name: Mind Map and Sketching
steps.description: A mind map was created to start defining the brand. Having certain keywords in mind, I then moved on to a sketching phase, where ideas started to flow by hand drawing the main components I wanted to include on the logo.

steps.name: Black and White Version
steps.description: The selected sketches were translated to Adobe Illustrator on a black and white version. The logos contain a guava fruit, which was traced from a royalty free image, using the pen tool. Balance and hierarchy were applied to create harmony and emphasize the more important information. The horizontal and vertical versions of the logo were completed.

steps.name: Final Version and Brief Document
steps.description: The selected colour palette was applied to the logos, making sure enough contrast was present. Compile the information on a company brief document.

steps.name: Poster Brainstorming
steps.description: To design the poster, the first step was to figure out the scene I wanted to create, I spent some time browsing royalty free images looking for inspiration, with the idea of a picnic or a park involved. Since this is a casual soft drink that is targeted for the general public and its a carbonated beverage, a can would be the most likely container to be used for it. This way it's relatively easy to transport and bring with you if you're out and about. The beverage is meant to be fun, refreshing and energizing, and we tend to associate these adjectives with the summertime, when people are spending more time outdoors and the weather is hotter.

steps.name: Pre-production
steps.description: The background image was selected from Adobe Stock, and the can 3D container was taken from the available models Adobe Dimension has. I also created a label that could be placed on the can as a decal, this was done on Adobe Illustrator. The logo has the main hierarchy, but also some informational data was added, like the size of the can and certification logos that would help identify the beverage's ingredients.

steps.name: Adobe Dimension
steps.description: The image was placed as a background image, and then the container was brought in using a fill colour and the label as a decal, to wrap around the can for a realistic effect. The 3D model perspective was matched to the background image. The most challenging part of the project was the lighting. This was my first time using Adobe Dimension, so it took some time to figure out the lighting options and settings. The final result was built with two light sources, one considered as “natural lighting” recreating the outdoor lighting the background image has, and because the natural light is hitting the can from behind/ to one side, an ambient light was added to help with the illumination of the front of the container, where the label is placed.

steps.name: Adobe Photoshop
steps.description: Once the poster was rendered, it was then exported to Adobe Photoshop, where the slogan text and certification logos were added. Typography and text colours were chosen to complement the container and provide enough contrast to be readable.
